BC-BC-KAN-BUDGET-KAN 
   (For use by New York Times News Service clients)  
   

   The Kansas City Star plans to move the following stories for use
by clients of the NYTimes News Service for AMs and PMs of Monday,
Jan. 4. If you have any questions, please call Kevin Catalano on
the Star's News Desk at (816) 234-4720.

   MONEY-FORFEITURES (Kansas City, Mo.) _ Police and federal
agencies have diverted millions of dollars from Missouri
schoolchildren. Under state law, money seized in drug cases is
supposed to go to public school districts, but some police
departments have found a simple way to keep the money for their own
use. By KAREN DILLON. 3 takes. Story will move in the ``a''
category.

   With four sidebars:

   LEGISLATORS-FORFEITURES (Kansas City, Mo.) _ Some Missouri
lawmakers are about to take another crack at making police send
money they seize in drug crimes to schools. So far, they've had
little success. By KAREN DILLON. Story will move in the ``a''
category.

   SCHOOLS-FORFEITURES (Kansas City, Mo.) _ Missouri law requires
police departments to send drug money they seize through state
courts _ and sometimes police do it. But even when they do, police
have used the court system to get the money back. By KAREN DILLON.
Story will move in the ``a'' category.

   RECORDS-FORFEITURES (Kansas City, Mo.) _ How can you find out
how much drug money law enforcement is keeping instead of sending
to Missouri schools? By looking at public records called DAG-71
reports. There's only one problem: You can't. By KAREN DILLON.
Story will move in the ``a'' category.

   FILES-FORFEITURES (Kansas City, Mo.) _ Although law enforcement
agencies refused to provide records that would show how much money
they were diverting from Missouri schools, The Kansas City Star
found 14 such cases in western Missouri. By KAREN DILLON. Story
will move in the ``a'' category.

   HEASTER-COLUMN (Undated) _ Once again, a Fearless Forecast for
the new year. Economics column by JERRY HEASTER. Story will move in
the ``f'' category.

   YOURCAREER-COLUMN (Undated) _ Companies without Y2K plans should
brace for lawsuits from employees. By DIANE STAFFORD. Story will
move in the ``f'' category.

   GUSEWELLE-COLUMN _ Column by C.W. GUSEWELLE will NOT move.
